Toured St. Vincent's new Cancer Center. Incredible! They raised $40m, and have state of the art cancer fighting technology. Go Bridgeport!
Supposed to be in Washington now, but instead, just shoveled several hundred pounds of snow out of my CT driveway. Ibuprofen here I come.
No votes tomorrow. Transitive errors in logic: Act of God (storm) shuts gov. Newt Gingrich shuts gov. Newt Gingrich is act of God. Hey . . .
Real tragedy mid-day yesterday in Middletown power plant explosion. My heart goes out to those families affected.
Great day off so far: had girls and dog down at beach, listened to Avett Bros "I and Love and You", gonna exercise to offset Superbowl feed.
With mayor Bill Finch at a meeting to assist Haitian families in Bridgeport. http://tiny.cc/emZPz Rest of day in Trumbull, Shelton, Monroe.
About to close NASDAQ in NYC. You can watch: http://tinyurl.com/95reb
House gym full and humming this morning w/the sound of New Year's resolutions being kept.
Was on Face the State this weekend. Check it out: http://tinyurl.com/yzlfq8g and http://tinyurl.com/ydhvruz
Weird world down here. Republicans are now opposing PAYGO and a fiscal responsibility commission, 2 things they've pushed for decades.
Headed south into DC. Looks like we're going into a storm, of the snow and budget varieties.
Now working on getting a $200k X-ray machine from Fuji in Stamford into Haiti. Stamford Hospital will provide Creole-speaking technicians.
Incredible story of the rescue of a young girl from Haiti. Best part of my week: http://tinyurl.com/ye3wj2q
Constitutional scholars no doubt a-twitter :) about the President's swipe at the Supremes and the Senate last night. Both deserved IMHO.
Will watch State of the Union tonight. I recorded some pre-speech reflections. Check'em out: http://tinyurl.com/yk2whz7
Postmodern moment: talking to reporter about tweets right now.
If you're interested in catching my time on npr this morning, here it is: http://tiny.cc/2FxvN
Attended Haiti memorial service in Stamford. Faith tested under gothic arches wondering how God allows such suffering to one small people.
Supreme Court ruling last week just heart crushing. We need $ out of politics, not in. Big step back for our democracy.
Moderated a panel for Autism Speaks yesterday. Hard to describe the challenges and exhaustion faced by parents of autistic kids.
Weird week in DC. The noise of everyone spinning MA drowned out a lot of the signal: people are pissed off about a lot of different things.
Three wonderful MLK celebrations today, at Mt. Aery in Bport, Norwalk and Yerwood Center in Stamford. Clear desire to carry on his legacy.
Stunning tragedy in Haiti. How can so much misfortune concentrate in so small a place? Please support Red Cross, Partners in Health.
Back in DC tonight. Classified hearing in Homeland Security tomorrow morning on what went wrong to allow Detroit underwear bomber through.
@Doncroc Re voting w/Pelosi, fact is, I have the most independent House record in New England. As Casey Stengel said, you could look it up.
Toured Derektor shipyard in Bport today. 400 people working there, good old-fashioned manufacturing, including the largest yacht ever built!
2 town hall meetings down on Afghanistan. Consensus anger at the fact that so few Americans are bearing the overall costs of our wars.
Afghanistan town hall really good last night. Lots of disagreement, but courteous and constructive. Does CT real credit.
Served lunch at Bridgeport Rescue Mission today. If you haven't, you have to volunteer there. It's magic. Afghanistan town hall tonight.
Merry Christmas, all! Lots of time with family, plus I got a half cord of firewood, Levi 501s, bourbon, and some black socks for Christmas!
Did my first clamming of the season this morning. Just finished lunch of clams and mussels. Headed to church later.
From McChrystal to the sergeant I had lunch with, our people are optimistic and gung ho, feel like they are making progress.
At Ramstein AFB in Germany after visit to Afghanistan. No way to capture impressions on tweet, but our people, mil and civil are amazing.
@WendyGav My votes have nothing to do with Nancy Pelosi. In last 10 days, have voted against two Democratic tax bills and one spending bill.
Voting done yesterday, prepping for trip to Afghanistan. Tonight I get to meet Paul Farmer of PIH and wife Ophelia Dahl (daughter of Roald)
Met with SecDef, SecState and VC JCOS on Afghanistan. Tough, tough issue. But these are deadly serious people. Some confidence in that.
Bill Finch and I met at Congress Street Bridge yesterday to announce that after 10 years of being an eyesore, we will begin replacing it.
Emma, Linley, Mary and I layed wreaths on veteran's graves in Darien. Happening all over the country and at Arlington.
Big roar of applause on Floor as Wall Street Reform/Consumer Protection bill passes.
Debating amendments to financial regulatory reform bill. Every American affected by the meltdown knows that this bill is key.
Having teletown hall in conjunction with AARP to talk about how senior citizens will be affected by health care reform. Great questions.
Attended Bishop Lori's open house today, now in Black Rock for the tree lighting. Not much snow on the ground, but beautiful music!
Saw Pirate Radio tonight. Great cast, whole lotta fun. Definitely recommend it if you're a Rock & Roll fan. Or a sailor.
Kevin--Now that's funny. Forthcoming subpoenas probably a little less so.
Director of Secret Service now answering questions for HS committee. Salahis apparently not showing up to testify.
@davidmarcus1 Like so many, I'll be watching Pres tonite. I plan to go to Afghanistan in 2-3 weeks to see/ask questions for myself.
World AIDS Day: Thousands of Americans don't know they're HIV+. We could save so much heartbreak/money with better education and prevention.
Watched the selectmen get sworn in tonight in Greenwich. Great turnout, almost filled the HS auditorium. Good luck to Peter, Dave, Drew.
Driving family down to Philly for dinner. Thankful, sad for those 700 CT guard troops away from family.
Take non-perishable food and packaged toys to 1088 Fairfield Ave., Bridgeport. You'll change lives. http://www.bridgeportrescuemission.org/
Served chili and rice at Bridgeport Rescue Mission today. They need your help with the wonderful work they do. See next tweet.
Spent an hour yesterday at Mercy Learning Center in Bport, where mom's are getting their GEDs and other training while kids are in school.
Marched in wonderful Stamford Thanksgiving Day parade, then took family to see Cirque du Soleil in NY. Girls were WIDE EYED.
But it does seem a little screwy.
@freon500 Pres is hammered for "rushing healthcare" but nailed for taking time on Afghanistan. Will now drop hardware analogies.
Infrastructure haiku: Plane ride home nightmare. Now on Elvis era train. Thank god for bar car.
Spoke to a group of students at the Library of Congress. If you ever come to DC, you must visit the library. They've got Jefferson's books!
Sitting in Homeland Security listening to advice on al-Qaida threat internally. Ft Hood was a terrible reminder of vulnerability.
Hurtling on gleaming rails back to DC. Big week on financial regulatory reform. Hopefully constructive healthcare work in the "other body".
Returning from sendoff ceremony for 700 CT Natl Guards deploying to Afghanistan. 'Thanks' falls so short of what we owe them/their families
Just raked about 1000 lbs of wet leaves from backyard. Going clamming in 45 minutes. Low tide at 3:30. Pasta with clams tonight.
End of a long week running from one end of district to the other. Cooking dinner for my Dad, who just moved to Connecticut.
Headed home after meeting in Bridgeport to try to stop the closing of the Noble post office. Bport's the biggest city in CT, for Pete's sake
Attended Vets ceremonies in Bport, Norwalk, Stamford. So grateful to these men and women who are/were prepared to sacrifice all for us.
Visiting senior centers around the district to explain how House health care would impact. ie. close doughnut hole, free checkups, etc.
Where I stand on healthcare: http://bit.ly/4jO8aJ
President now with us in Cannon. Big day
Almost done reading/considering health care bill. Note that AARP and AMA have endorsed it. Looks like vote tomorrow.
@nanluvsmatt Good morning. Not true. If u were blocked, wouldn't have seen your post. Always happy to hear from constituents!
@seniorobserver Saddest because there must be a distinction between the partisan rough/tumble and shared awe for the democratic process.
W/few courageous exceptions, GOP caucus walks out en masse as 2 new members (dems from specials) are sworn in. Saddest thing I've seen here.
Real carnival atmosphere down here around healthcare. Pro and Con tribes gathering w/flags, chants, visits. Suspect will play host to both!
You'll get a kick out of: http://bit.ly/1dqrMb
Floor discussion looking more like 8:30 at this point.
CSpan junkies: will be on Floor around 7:15, 7:30 to talk financial regulatory reform. Pop some popcorn, put up your feet, good family fun.
Orchestrated 'Just Say No' tweets are drowning out all others. Constituent tweets buried. Will probably block out-of-district participants.
PM Angela Merkel addressed joint session. 1st time I've worn funny tranlating headset.
Had Ed Secretary Arne Duncan in CT yesterday. Great meeting with education leaders in district. So hungry for when we focus on education.
Took the girls trick/treating. They're now old enough to be fast and acquisitive. Have enough candy to be sugar-addled til Independence Day.
Took a family up into the capitol dome. Hundreds of feet above Washington. Amazing view outside and in. Not for those with fear of heights.
New healthcare bill online now. I'll be reading it til asleep tonight. Take a look at http://bit.ly/gy2Bs
Geithner in committee. Confusion on both sides. Resolution authority is not bailout. It means big firms fail orderly. Just like small.
Late night in office. Wading through systemic regulator bill. Resolution authority key: blow it, and you WILL fail. But in orderly fashion.
Defense bill signed by President today. Pay raises for our soldiers.
Investment Advisers Registration Act passes out of committee 67-1. Now that's bipartisan!
Big week in financial services. Investor protection, adviser registration, office of insurance, rating agency bills to be marked up.
Cruising into DC on Acela. First meeting of my veteran's advisory committee today. We're not doing enough to help returning vets reintegrate
Pres:"I dont want the folks who made this mess to say we're not mopping fast enough."
President inviting bankers in the room to work constructively on new/better regulation.
Amtraking to Stamford with Rep. Murphy to see President. Train home so much more productive vs flying.
Just passed Coast Guard Authorization bill, including Himes amendment to train boaters to be eyes/ears around nautical infrastructure.
@freon500 Actually, read every tweet. Can't respond to the many hundreds, but read 'em all.
Tweet from The Seat (TM): Presiding tonite. Colleagues from IL, MN, CO telling stories of people w/no health insurance. Harrowing.
STRA included Himes Amendment to include concentrating photovoltaics. Very efficient, made by Opel in Shelton. Strong bipartisan support.
House just passed Solar Technology Roadmap Act. Serious about solar technology R&D and investement. How do we find ourselves behind China?
Passed consumer finance protection bill out of committee. With derivatives bill of last week, it's important. Next to Senate, Pres, LAW.
Realized when I referred to "minority colleague" some thought I meant ethnic minority. In fact, meant Republican. Gotta watch the DC-speak!
Got to participate in a Habitat for Humanity house blessing in Bridgeport. What a great group!
Good progress yesterday on Consumer Finance Protection bill. Now back to Norwalk for annual NEON celebration. Super group really helping.
Passed OTC Derivatives Act out of committee. Important technical stuff, but no campaign bumper sticker there!
Watching Costa Rica vs US world cup qualifier w/old friend, HUD secretary Shaun Donovan.
Minority colleague just said he's glad his dad is gone so he wont see consumer finance reform. Sheesh.
House just passed Iran Sanctions Act. Hopefully will ratchet pressure on Iran to stop nuke development.
@WendyGav Rangel charges being closely investigated by bipartisan Ethics committee, when they report, action will be taken accordingly.
Met w/Ali Gomaaa, Egypt's top cleric. Urged him to issue fatwa categorically rejecting terrorism, and to get other Muslim leaders to do so.
Leaving NIH. Doing amazing things against cancer using immunology. Really impressive.
Unusual DC day: all morning hearings on investor protection; all pm at NIH research hospital.
Upon meeting Mario Testa, he ordered a full Italian meal delivered for the road. Said his staff had given him nothing but muffins all day.
VP is the most gregarious man I've ever seen. I watched his staff visibly age as he spoke at length w/everyone he met.
@SM_NC Stamford Museum & Nature Center is a real jewel. My daughters are obsessed with it. Unfortunately, VP's agenda beyond my control!
Merritt project hired 60 people, will hire another 70 or so. Need to see more of that faster.
Travelling w/VP to view stimulus project on Merritt. The man does not travel light.
Norwalk, Bport and St. Vincent's hospitals all having big events tonight! Health care everywhere!
Just visited Opel, a solar energy company in Shelton. 25 jobs, clean energy. Many more jobs possible.
Listening to Bernanke: "Nobody's more sick & tired of bailouts than me."
Hearing on credit rating agencies now. One thing is clear: investors should and will rely a whole lot less on them in future.
Revelation of Iran nuke facility at Qom deeply disturbing. Chinese and Russians had better get on board with the sanctions.
Spoke to about 100 students at Housatonic Community College. Most of them are not close to adequately prepared by their high schools.
Took the girls out for large peperoni pizza and family swim at the YMCA.
Had a "Morir Sonando" at Dominican cafe. Orange, sugarcane, vanilla. Means "Die Dreaming".
Walking E Main St. in Bport visiting small business owners. Seems to be slight biz uptick.
Done for week in DC. Still lots of work to be done on healthcare reform. Progress, but it's very slow.
In hearing with Fed official on additional oversight-Ron Paul's bill
In hearing w/Sec Geithner. Focusing hard on fin services reg reform. Much will happen in next 3 weeks. Now is time for comments/ideas!
Holding an AARP sponsored tele-town hall with seniors in my district. Great questions. Off to vote shortly.
Visited car dealer today. Did 37 cash for clunker deals. Waiting on payment on just one. Sounds like problems were worked out.
Visited the Bishop shouted down at my Norwalk town hall for speaking Spanish. He/his people are concerned, but his faith is about forgiving.
L'shanah tovah!
Back in CT. Gathered a big group of doctors and some lawyers at Norwalk Hospital to try to get to bottom of tort reform/defensive medicine.
For cspan junkies, House voting on my amendment pushing financial literacy in about 25 minutes.
Attended Top Secret briefing on Afghanistan. Situation deteriorating. Pentagon preparing to ask for more troops. Need focus on this problem.
House just passed Advanced Vehicle Research, which kickstarts R&D on American vehicles of the future. Detroit in, Saudi/Veneuela out?
Looks like there will be a resolution of "disapproval" of Wilson today. He refused to apologize to House. What do you all think?
Presiding on floor at 6:30.
President was kind enough to offer me a lift to DC on his plane. POTUS travels well. Wondering if rude to swipe the AF1 M&Ms.
Today I hope we honor the lost by remembering our common blessings and aspirations--that feeling we all had shortly after the attacks.
Just crossed the 500 followers mark. Really appreciate the comments that come in at @jahimes
Joe Wilson's office right next to mine. Press camped out. He will reap a well-deserved whirlwind. We should fight, but never disrespect.
Great speech by Pres last night. Reminded us why reform is critical, indicated openness to debate, negotiation, new ideas. Right tone.
Back in DC, carrying an earful from my constituents. Bunch of meetings tomorrow am to convey ideas and see where others are.
Press conference in New Canaan today to discuss Pres speech controversy. Open inquiry is right. Quashing speech is never right.
Critical thinking key to our democracy. Agree or disagree, why not get family together to discuss/debate President's statement? But censor?
Relaxing a little prior to the starting gun on Tuesday. So saddened by parents wanting their kids not to see President's speech.
Bridgeport Health Care meeting tonight changed to KLEIN AUDITORIUM. 6:30. Need the space. Spread the word!
Home after 1200 person healthcare town hall in Norwalk. Vigorous, to say the least. Lots of opinions. Some loud. Much better than apathy.
2 Congress on Your Corners turned into Health Care town halls in Wilton and Weston today. Hundreds of people there. Good robust debate.
Had 2 move Norwalk health care forum AGAIN-now @ Norwalk HS. Great  interest in good debate but hard 2 find venues 4 hc events these days
@ptbarnaby Sit on Homeland Security. #1 worry is nuclear weapons+militant Islam. Israel works on that 24/7. Learning + relationships key.
Met w/General Dayton, who's training West Bank police. Rare man in the area: an optimist.
With colleagues on way to see President Shimon Peres. Sat last nite looking up at old city walls. Magical.
On my way with 30 colleagues, to tel aviv. Meeting with Peres, Netanyahu, Abu Mazen. Agenda: Iran, peace process.
@pastorkginyard Yes, though signs are starting to look up, way too many people out of work. Need to look at support and benefits in Sep.
With all the press on the appalling disruptions of town hall meetings, am very proud of the one we had in Stamford. Will have more.
Great visit to Sikorsky yesterday. Make the Blackhawk, all important to our troops. Hard working CT folks making things. Need more of that.

Just finished really good impromptu town hall mtg in Stamford. Mostly healthcare.
Strong opinions, lively debate. Democracy alive/well.
Met with about 30 doctors tonight. Very interesting thoughts offered up. Now enjoying a gorgeous CT night, assisted by a Miller "Chill".
@jillosophy I am adamant for healthcare reform. It's crucial to our people and our economy. But, doing it right is more important than fast.
Whole staff came over to my place tonight for burgers/dogs cooked by yours truly. Good fellowship, no food poisoning. Can't beat that.
At Norwalk American Legion honoring Nick Madaras, young Army PFC killed in Iraq. Mother has org sending soccer balls to youngsters in Iraq.
Silent drill team performs long, intricate close-order drill in dark w/no audible commands. Perfect precision. Makes you proud. Semper Fi!
On train to CT. Went to USMC Evening Parade at DC barracks last nite. One of most amazing things I've ever seen. If in DC, GO! Friday nites.
At White House to talk with Rahm about consumer products regulator. Industry fighting it like mad. Sorting responsible from ir not easy.
Minority selling idea that stimulus not creating jobs. See front page NYT yesterday. Tell that to 20 new police in Bport thanks to stimulus.
Just finished H1N1 briefing. Vaccine being developed. Everyone watching South America to see how virus behaves during their winter.
Watching Capitol Police show polite interest in man approaching in Santa suit on a skateboard. Guys must have good stories!
If Lincoln were around, what would he say was our "unfinished work"? Would he be proud of us?
Ran to Lincoln. Might have been heat exhaustion, but couldn't stop reading the "dedicated here to the unfinished work" part of the address.
Doing some late night work/reading on healthcare. Hugely challenging policy. Unclear where it's going this week, but lots lots of discussion
Beautiful day in CT. Headed up to Bridgeport to celebrate Peru Independence Day. Am told I'm the first Member born in Lima.
Voting. 18 times separated by 2 mins. Easy to miss 1 if you get into a conversation or paperwork.
Lunch with TreasSec Geithner. Pushing financial services reform hard, says no clear need for Stimulus II now.
Had 2 groups of wonderful high school students visit me today. Unbelievably good questions, engaged, tough. America remaking itself.
Listening to Doug Elmendorf, who caused the quake last week. Smart on how to reduce costs in healthcare.
Breakfast w/SecDef Gates. Smart, blunt, not afraid to say exactly what he thinks. Need more people in gov like him.
Bernanke in front of financial services today. Economy improving, but not jobs. Concerned about anything encroaching on independent mone ...
Touching ceremony today in Darien to honor WWII veterans. Several got up to tell their stories. Best part--gotta do more of that.
Just back from the White House. President said he's listening on healthcare, and that we're at start of process. Much work to do.
@jimccarson Do try to respond to every letter and email. Can't respond to every tweet, though do read them all.
Watching Judy Chu of California get sworn in. Her dad came from China with nothing. Now she's a US Congresswoman.
Back from a BBQ w/VP. Pretty darn nice house. Biden has also got to be one of the more authentic guys in politics. Not a lot of spin there.
Couple of hours set aside tonight to read the healthcare bill just introduced.
Put a little CD player in my office for after-hours stress redux. Billy Mann sent me a Diane Birch CD "bible belt"-great blues/gospel!
In Financial Services committee listening to Mary Schapiro discuss how to fix the SEC. Cultural change not easy.
In Trumbull for Congress on Your Corner, 3-5. At Poricelli's. Come talk about anything.
In combined hearing of Financial Services and Ag. Seems like half the Congress. Sec Geithner testifying on how to deal with derivatives.
Tweet from the Seat: If you repeat a falsehood often enough, does alchemy turn it into truth?
Tweet from the Seat: Presiding til midnight. One Republican in chamber calling Obama's health plan "socialized medicine"
@seniorobserver Pastor Bennett is Baptist. Namaste means, I believe, "the Divinity in me salutes the Divinity in you".
Just had Pastor Anthony Bennett of Bridgeport give the opening prayer in the House. He was terrific. Opened with a hearty "Namaste!".
Great seminar today with Perlmutter, Hodes and Whitehouse (cold winter caucus) on our GREEN housing bill. Makes big difference on energy use
Back in action in DC. As expected, health care, health care, health care. Plus an incredible schedule on financial regulatory reform.
@pastorkginyard Thanks for your good wishes, Rev. And more importantly, for your leadership, commitment and good works in Bridgeport!
Big birthday yesterday. Today's mine. 43. Good old fashioned New England clambake later with parents/aunts/uncles/sisters/kids. Rhubard pie.
". . . we mutually pledge to each other our Lives, our Fortunes and our Sacred Honor." How could you not want to be a part of that?!?
Off duty soon. Plan to go for a run on this beautiful CT summer afternoon. Am a far better runner than I am a pitcher.
Six towns, nine hours. Home for a cold beer and to make sure our new dog hasn't fully displaced me!
Loosening up my arm to throw first pitch at Bridgeport Bluefish game. Many many years since Little League, and very conscious of youtube.
Held training today for small businesses looking for help from SBA. Gave keynote at Bridgeport Regional Biz Council.
So there's 2 sets of facts from way opposite sides of the energy debate showing real BENEFIT to CT households.
NRDC's work (and note I started with a coal co's data) shows CT households SAVING $8.11
CT folks worried about ACES should look at Murray Energy Corp's (they hate ACES) map of US. Shows CT consumers getting $26 million BENEFIT.
At East End Baptist Tabernacle church this a.m. Beautiful young black lab has joined the Himes household. Dogs seem to add chaos and joy.
People always ask about bipartisanship. Energy bill would have failed but for the courageous votes of 8 Republicans. 44 Dems opposed.
Finally a gorgeous day in CT. Much feedback on energy bill. More people pro than con. After many decades, inaction no longer an option.
Boehner now making a last ditch stand to derail the energy bill. A filibuster in the House!
On Floor. Ellen Tauscher giving her valedictory. Going to State AND getting married tomorrow.
@DTCahill Non-partisan CBO puts energy bill cost at .40/day/family. Or we guzzle Saudi oil and watch new energy jobs in Europe/Asia.
A public option, though, is just part of the extremely difficult project of taking the explosive cost growth out of the healthcare system.
@ConnecticutMan1 I support a public option. I've said that whenever and wherever asked. I signed HCAN principles months ago.
Now taking 19 votes on Floor, all related to Homeland Security Approps Act. 2 minute votes-another speed round.
Met with Rahm today on energy bill. They are pushing it very hard, hoping to get it to the Floor on Friday.
Back from event we had to explain 9/11-GI bill benefits to veterans. Flying to DC early tomorrow. Rumors of energy bill getting to Floor.
Dad's Day and Summer Solstice at once. Didn't live with my Dad growing up. Despite my work, hope I'm there when my daughters need me.
Impeaching a federal judge. Only 13 in our history. Was convicted of sexually assaulting his staff and lied in court. Don't get to do that.
52 votes. A US history record. Pizza delivered to cloakroom. Normally shiny congresspeople looking very rumpled.
Minority delaying. We have voted all day. Old timers say this has never happened before-50ish votes
28 votes in a row right now. Most separated by 5 minutes. Lot of Floor time today. SecTreas probably cooling his heels in Rayburn.
In East Room. President about to announce Financial Regulatory Reform.
Met with Elizabeth Warren. Combines facts, analysis, passion and communication ability more than any policy maker I know.
Ambushed by a vote at 8:30pm while going for a run. Mayhem as Members came in from all over. Procedural jockeying before budget process.
Appeared on MSNBC "Rising Stars" this morning. Flattering. But the Greeks warned: whom the Gods would destroy, they first call promising.
War Supplemental bill getting ever more complex. Cash-for-clunkers in, torture photo restriction out, IMF in. 3 dimensional political chess.
@jillybean65 Georgetown, CT. Though neither is probably known for chili!
Back on House Floor. Sitting here amidst the hubub of our democracy, hoping, hoping for change in Iran. So good to see people there rising.
Scalp is sweating.
Just tasted 24 chilis in Georgetown.
Tomorrow starts at VFW convention in Hartford, ends in Greenwich where I'll drive the Coda, a new American all-electric car.
Tobacco bill smokin' its way through today. Heat in DC is already overwhelming, and it ain't even summer yet.
9 votes total, 7 of which are 2 minute votes. It's a Congressional Speed Round! Will slow when the minority offers its motion to recommit.
He knows that appalling Hamas and Hizballah orgs win followers offering services and building schools. We need to win hearts and minds.
Voting for State Dept authorization. USMC General Jim Jones pushed this bill hard at State and in Congress. Why? See next.
Just voted for Cash for Clunkers. Strong bipartisan support, but wish the mileage standards were stronger. Too bad.
Pilot says we're in "grey zone". Assume that's aeronautical term. I'm thinking: TRAIN.
Lieberman and Dodd aboard too, so 43% of CT delegation now stuck on tarmac.
On the typically delayed shuttle NYC-DC
Gave speech on Norwalk Green for dedication of WWI cannon, then mowed the rain-created jungle in my backyard.
Wonderful unveiling of WWII Memorial in Bport yesterday, then clambake with Alliance Francaise remembering our nations' friendship.
Saw Chuck Schumer today. He was traveling with his daughter! Says there's good support for a public option/health care in Senate.
Voted late last nite. Back in CT. Leadership trying to get a military supplemental compromise. Some hate war funding, some hate IMF monies.
Bernanke re audit of Fed: audit programs, activities, but monetary policy must be independent of politics. He's right.
Lunch w/Chairman Bernanke. Optimistic. "Delighted with outcome of stress tests" of banks.
Unveiling of Ronald Reagan statue in Rotunda today. Just walked by big dinner in Capitol to celebrate. Wasn't invited.
Tweet from Seat: minority now denying climate change, decrying reduction of freedom. Noting that change from winter to spring is good.
Tweet from the Seat. Late nite long speeches. Freshmen Dems calling for action on energy. Invoking JFK.
Gov of MT spoke at dinner. Great speaker. Called our energy challenges the sputnik of this generation. NYC then DC tomorrow.
Ribbon cutting for renovated 120 unit Friendship House in Stamford. Great story! Now in Hartford for JJB Dinner.
Back in action today. Met with great group of Obama supporters in Wilton. Really anxious to stay engaged and be helpful to the Pres.
No politics! Finally day off. Kayak in the morning, mowed the lawn, now a swim. R&R after a pretty hard week. Rhett: tomorrow is another day
Met with execs of Norwalk hospital and Greater valley Chamber. Great discussions. Barbecue on the beach with Emma and Linley tonight.
Town Hall meeting in Fairfield. People very worried about cap and trade. Some anger in the room. Hard to tell if organized or organic.
Strange world. Gave keynote at Harvard Club dinner at Darien Country Club. It was there that an angry drunk nearly took a swing at me.
Oops, bad post. Just left congressional arts contest. Wonderful art by local students. Winner is displayed in Capitol.
Mem Day parades in Stamford, Monroe, veterans old and young. Low level flyby by 2 Blackhawks. Not too proud to say that was really cool.
Walked in Redding Mem Day parade. Beautiful New England town, firetrucks and army jeeps, haunting notes of Taps across grassy fields.
Arrived in CT to find a home invasion happened across street. Seems no one hurt. Police everywhere and jumpy given history in CT.
Hoping this is the 1st ever Tweet From the Seat. Presiding over House. King of IA decrying imminent Marxist takeover.
Lengthy hearings on Section 8 and the pummeled muni bond market today. Do I lose followers if I say I find that stuff pretty interesting?
Leaving White House, pres signed housing bill, we passed credit card bill. Good day's work.
Will shortly offer amendment to Small Biz bill to create Microenterprise Training Centers for lower income entrepreneurs
On the Floor trying to move the very good credit card bill. Senator Coburn requiring we tie it to guns in National Parks. Jeez.
Cspan friends: going on Floor in next 15-30 mins to fight FAA's rerouting planes over my district.
In Homeland Security. Committee is seeking docs behind the department's look at veterans as a security risk.
After votes, laced up the running shoes, visited WWII Memorial. Majestic. Not as haunting as its neighbor, Vietnam.
Rebuilt dock. Town Hall meeting with Ned Lamont in Ridgefield. All healthcare. Cooking daughters pasta with spicy sausage.
Training home from MD New Dem policy conference. 36 hrs R&R then back to healthcare, energy, jobs, H1N1
No votes today. Dealing with monumental piles of paper on desk. Work as I used to know it.
Dropped by Lincoln Memorial last night around 11pm after Kennedy Center gig. There is no place like it. Sacred.
Some fireworks today in Democratic caucus over war supplemental appropriation. Lots of members having problems sending more money to Iraq
Family and I helped release four beautiful hawks into the wild today. Dara Reid and Wildlife in Crisis are magnificent.
Taking Mary and girls out to lunch, then family to a rehabbed hawk-release in Weston. Beautiful day!
Just passed a law to create a bipartisan Pecora-like commission to look into the causes of the financial crisis. Not gov at its most exc ...
1st full day off in weeks. Church. Installed screens. Weedwhacked. Too wet to mow. Jungle soon. Off to dinner with old friends.
